name: Red Bull Racing
description: Red Bull Racing has dominated recent years of F1, winning multiple constructors' championships with their innovative design philosophy and strong driver lineup.

name: Ferrari
description: The most successful and iconic team in F1 history, Ferrari is the oldest surviving team and has won more races and championships than any other constructor.

name: Mercedes
description: Mercedes dominated the turbo-hybrid era from 2014-2020, winning seven consecutive constructors' championships with their superior power unit and aerodynamic excellence.

name: McLaren
description: One of F1's most successful teams, McLaren has won multiple championships and is known for their technological innovation and distinctive papaya orange livery.

name: Aston Martin
fullName: Aston Martin Aramco Cognizant F1 Team
description: Previously known as Racing Point and Force India, the team was rebranded as Aston Martin in 2021, marking the iconic British brand's return to F1.

name: Alpine
description: The works Renault team rebranded as Alpine in 2021, continuing the French manufacturer's long history in F1 under their sports car brand.

name: Williams
description: One of F1's most successful independent teams, Williams has won nine constructors' championships and continues to operate as a family-founded racing team.

name: RB
fullName: Visa Cash App RB F1 Team
description: Formerly AlphaTauri and Toro Rosso, RB serves as Red Bull's sister team, developing young drivers and testing innovative concepts for the main team.

name: Sauber
description: The Swiss team will become Audi's works team in 2026, currently operating as Stake F1 Team with a focus on developing their infrastructure for the future.

name: Haas
description: The first American F1 team in decades, Haas operates with a unique model of purchasing as many components as legally allowed from other teams.
